org.garret.perst
Class Decimal

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Number
      org.garret.perst.Decimal
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<Decimal>, IValue
public class Decimal
extends java.lang.Number
implements java.lang.Comparable<Decimal>, IValue

Class representing 64-bit decimal number. It provides fixed point arithmetic and can be also used in Lucene full text search engine to convert number to strings with proper lexicographical order (so range operator in Lucene query can be used for numeric fields). This class supports operations only for number having the same precision and width.

See Also:

nIntegerDigits - maximal number of digits in integer part of the number
nFractionDigits - number of digits in fractional part of the number

Decimal

public Decimal(long value,
               int nIntegerDigits,
               int nFractionDigits)
Constructor of decimal number from scaled value with given width and precision

Parameters:
value - scaled value of the number, i.e. 123456 for 1234.56
nIntegerDigits - maximal number of digits in integer part of the number
nFractionDigits - number of digits in fractional part of the number

Decimal

public Decimal(java.lang.String value)
Constructor of decimal number from string representation. Maximal number of digits in integer and fractional part of the number are calculated based on the given string value, i.e. for string "00123.45" it will be 5 and 2 correspondently

Parameters:
value - string representation of the number

public java.lang.String toLexicographicString()
Get string representation of the given decimal number which been compared with another such string representation of decimal number will produce the same comparison result as of original decimal numbers
